page.title: 11BERE FERRERS W.I.
page.content: The W.I. try to help other people in their village and abroad. The W.I. helped to restore the village pump. The village pump is situated by the church hall that was once the school. The W.I. also provided curtains for the church-hall. The W.I. received a letter from a lady in Nigeria saying that the people did not know how to sew. The W.I. responded to the lady by sending packets of needlework equipment to Nigeria. The W.I. heard about the famine in Ethiopia so they decided to raise some money. The W.I. sold T-shirts to raise lots of money to send to Ethiopia. The W.I. had a talk about guide dogs for the blind. In the lower part of the village there is a conservation area, cared for by the W.I. The W.I.members complained to British Railways when the train was going to be taken away.
